track.name: Calm Like a Bomb
comments: I feel this song is one of the main reasons why The Battle of Los Angeles should be seen as Rage's crowning achievement. Yes yes, we all know the debut is amazing but to play the devil's advocate it's essentially just rapping over hard rock riffs. Whereas on Battle they came up with the perfect alchemy of hip hop, hard rock, funk, punk and what have you. It's musically and sonically their most inventive album. As revolutionary as they were from the get-go, a song like this in 1992 would have blown heads off.
This song is just massive. It comes from every angle sonically, rhythmically, and lyrically, and just crushes you. "Watcha say? Watcha say? Watcha say? What?" [2]
This song is just massive.  It comes from every angle sonically, rhythmically, and lyrically, and just crushes you.  "Watcha say?  Watcha say?  Watcha say?  What?"
cool great bass solos this is rage against the machine R.A.T.M
I think this is at the end of Matrix: Reloaded though, right? And 'Wake Up' at the end of the first one.
@Graycloak The song at the end of The Martix is Wake Up, not this one.
This ain't subliminal, Feel the critical mass approach horizon...hehe...
